> 8 hours ago, Mandella said:
> 
> 
> You are right about the stock calibration, but all settings are reachable from the settings screen at the space center. You can just divide/multiply the necessary settings by four easily enough -- no patch needed.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> At least that is how I have done it in my <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> game.
> 

I was tweaking the consumation values in-game and found 2 variables that aren't defined in the config wiki (Scout Hab Time and Perma-Hab time).Can you give me a quick introduction to them?

Edit: maybe even a quick look at your <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> config , I don't know how much I have to change things and I fear that changing too much is like cheating.

Oh last thing : I noticed that LS in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> gives me different values than LS on the launchpad.Am I missing something or..?

![NFXNzKt.png](https://i.imgur.com/NFXNzKt.png)

> Oh last thing : I noticed that LS in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> gives me different values than LS on the launchpad.Am I missing something or..?

You must manually start recyclers and hab modules. They're switched off when you launch.

> 8 hours ago, Mandella said:
> 
> 
> You are right about the stock calibration, but all settings are reachable from the settings screen at the space center. You can just divide/multiply the necessary settings by four easily enough -- no patch needed.
> 

The problem is when you see unqualified days, like for example "500 days", is that Kerbin-days or Earth-days?  Others knew that if it was MKS, it's Kerbin-days, but I didn't before now.  Statute miles and nautical miles differ less, but people died in World War 2 because aircraft ranges in statute miles were compared to mission distances in nautical miles.  It's why aircraft always use nautical miles now no matter the service.

If the time is hours, that's okay, because the hour is the same.  But now days should always be qualified as Kerbin-days or Earth-days.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Mr. Sandman said:
> 
> 
> Oh yeah I know , but the values are still off from the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> values.What am I doing wrong?
> 

Make sure, that you have all habs on (I don't see the rest of the list from <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>) and maybe try to cheat your vessel to orbit to check, if the values are correct there.

If you need the other stuff:

![Mc1EyCB.png](https://i.imgur.com/Mc1EyCB.png)

Don't know what your doing so it's hard to say.![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")  You need to provide a little more information.

What do you mean "...the mechanics show up..."?  Do you see the LS windows in the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> and <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>??

What versions of KSP and <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS/<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> MKS are you using? How did you install them (<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> or manually)?  Are you in a career game and haven't researched them yet?

For future reference, see this thread.

Oh I'm not new to KSP , it's just that I don't know how to fix this weird display bug.

Let me explain: In the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> I have my <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS window that tells me Supplies , EC and Hab.They tell me I have 2 years worth of supplies and Hab , but then on the Launchpad (with all the life support system active) it says I have 2 years of supplies BUT 112 days of Hab time.

I'm using the 1.2.2 KSP version (since <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> 1.3 is not ready yet) and I installed <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> (so I can't be wrong on the version).My gamemode is sandbox.

Sorry for the misunderstanding.

> 
> 
> 8 minutes ago, Mr. Sandman said:
> 
> 
> Oh I'm not new to KSP , it's just that I don't know how to fix this weird display bug.
> 

I'm sure and I think the same thing happens to me (don't quote me on that) but, unfortunately, my post wasn't meant for you ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I always feel inadequate asking any questions about mods online, clearly the answers are out there but I can't seem to find them. I guess when you have such a beloved mod the questions begin to repeat. 

Anyway if you will indulge me. I have read a few guides and while they explain I broad strokes my problem is so simple I can't figure the damn thing out. I am using in conjunction with the <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> inventory mod.

I have a command module with two Kerbals, I add supplies to the command module seat inventory but my Kerbals don't have access to those supplies at launch. I am still limited to 15 days. 

This is an early career game so I do not have access to any greenhouses yet and I have limited habitation solutions. However I am sure I'm doing something wrong with the supplies. 

Is there a guide on the most basic aspects of how to use this mod? Or can someone explain how to get the supplies to work?

> 
> 
> 12 hours ago, Mr. Sandman said:
> 
> 
> Let me explain: In the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> I have my <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS window that tells me Supplies , EC and Hab.They tell me I have 2 years worth of supplies and Hab , but then on the Launchpad (with all the life support system active) it says I have 2 years of supplies BUT 112 days of Hab time.
>

> 
> I'm using the 1.2.2 KSP version (since <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> 1.3 is not ready yet) and I installed <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> (so I can't be wrong on the version).My gamemode is sandbox.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Sorry for the misunderstanding.

Normally, no support for older versions.  But make sure you actually turned the modules on post launch.  And sorry, you totally CAN be on the wrong version, because <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> is sketchy as hell.  Especially with out of date versions, and exponentially sketchy with out of date versions and dependencies (which <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS has).

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, Alexology said:
> 
> 
> I have a command module with two Kerbals, I add supplies to the command module seat inventory but my Kerbals don't have access to those supplies at launch. I am still limited to 15 days.
> 

This is correct - <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS has no awareness of stuff shoved into <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> inventories.  

If your problem is hab, add more pods.

If your problem is supplies... add supply containers.  Or recyclers.  

Make sure you turn hab and recyclers on.
